meanings.definition: A period of time during which a group of people meet to discuss or engage in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: During the study sess, the students worked together on their project.
meanings.sent2: The team had a productive sess to plan the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The book club's sess turned into a lively debate about the ending.
meanings.sent4: In the sess of ideas, creativity flowed freely among the participants.
meanings.sent5: The sess was filled with brainstorming and collaboration.

meanings.definition: To sit down or settle in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: After a long walk, she decided to sess on the park bench.
meanings.sent2: The family likes to sess together in the living room after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat chose to sess on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, they began to sess around the campfire.
meanings.sent5: He likes to sess by the fireplace with a good book.

meanings.sent1: The teacher needed to sess the students' understanding of the lesson.
meanings.sent2: It's important to sess the risks before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: She had to sess the damage caused by the storm.
meanings.sent4: The doctor will sess your condition before prescribing any medication.
meanings.sent5: He will sess the situation before offering any advice.
